metadata.Title: CVE-2019-11191 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - negligible
metadata.Description:
** DISPUTED ** The Linux kernel through 5.0.7, when CONFIG_IA32_AOUT isenabled and ia32_aout is loaded, allows local users to bypass ASLR onsetuid a.out programs (if any exist) because install_exec_creds() is calledtoo late in load_aout_binary() in fs/binfmt_aout.c, and thus theptrace_may_access() check has a race condition when reading /proc/pid/stat.NOTE: the software maintainer disputes that this is a vulnerability becauseASLR for a.out format executables has never been supported.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11191` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-generic - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-164-lowlatency - 4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1054-aws - 4.4.0-1045.48
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').

linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-150.176~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1045.48').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
